sentences.english: In answer to the ring, appeared a page boy with a silver soup tureen.
sentences.chinese: 按过铃，一个小男仆就捧了一只盛汤的银器进来。

sentences.english: Dessert silverware, if not brought out with the dessert, are placed at the top of your entrée plate.
sentences.chinese: 如果甜品没摆出来，装甜品的银器就放在主菜盘。

sentences.english: Age -old jade artifacts, gold and silver ornaments, and paintings - just to name a few.
sentences.chinese: 远古玉器，金银器，名画，还有好多其他的。

sentences.english: Stoke the fire, break out the silver, wake the china.
sentences.chinese: 快生火，拿出银器，叫醒瓷碟。

sentences.english: Highly polished silver was displayed in gleaming glass cabinets;
sentences.chinese: 擦得发亮的银器陈列在明亮的玻璃柜里。

sentences.english: The gold and silver plates of Liao dynasty are beautiful flowers of the northern nomadic people.
sentences.chinese: 辽代金银器是北方草原地区民族历史文物的一支奇葩。

sentences.english: And, in the first place, was that silver ours?
sentences.chinese: 首先，那些银器难道真是我们的吗？

sentences.english: Those six sets of silver haunted him.
As I took my seat I was greeted by a dazzling array of silverware at my place setting.
sentences.chinese: 刚一落座，我就被面前摆放的银器弄得眼花缭乱。

sentences.english: Why can't the widow get back her silver snuffbox that was stole?
sentences.chinese: 寡妇为什么就找不到被偷走的那只银器的鼻烟盒子呢？

sentences.english: He polished the silver until it gleamed.
sentences.chinese: 他擦亮银器直到它闪烁。

sentences.english: old silver.-- From the ladle one could get at least two hundred francs.
sentences.chinese: 并且是古银器，连那大勺至少可以卖二百法郎。

sentences.english: I don't CARE for expensive dinners served on silver.
sentences.chinese: 我不喜欢以银器备置的昂贵晚餐。

sentences.english: Firstly put some silver cleaner on a cotton pad (in the inventory) and use it on the chronometer.
sentences.chinese: 先在物品栏里把棉垫和银器清洗剂组合，用在表上。

sentences.english: The tables were immaculately laid with fine silverware and Wedgwood china .
sentences.chinese: 下表是一尘不染奠定细银器和韦奇伍德瓷器。

sentences.english: Trying to get the silverware clean we have to exert ourselves to rub away for hours.
sentences.chinese: 为把银器擦亮，我们必须花几个小时很费劲地擦拭。

definition: bronze implement/refers to ancient bronze artifacts, from c. 2,000 BC
